## GAD-7 vs CHAT

When conducting research studies, psychologists often have to engage in the process of harmonisation by comparing the items from different questionnaires. Such as the Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7) and Checklist for Autism in Toddlers (CHAT). In the comparison of GAD-7 vs CHAT, time-consuming and subjective processes of manual harmonisation can serve as a significant deterrent for researchers. # Why Choose Harmony for GAD-7 vs CHAT For hassle-free comparison and harmonisation of questionnaires like GAD-7 vs CHAT, Harmony offers an excellent solution. Harmony is a smart, intuitive software that leverages natural language processing and AI to help researchers in harmonising questionnaire items. Whether it is percentage match between each item or comparisons in multiple languages, Harmony simplifies the process for GAD-7 vs CHAT by facilitating easy selection from its database or uploading the personal instruments in PDF form. # The Edge of Harmony in GAD-7 vs CHAT Comparison Harmony's large language model effectively compares the instruments, making the comparison of GAD-7 vs CHAT efficient, objective, and accurate. With Harmony, researchers can finally spend less time on tedious data entry and focus more on drawing valuable inferences. By choosing Harmony for GAD-7 vs CHAT comparison, psychologists pave the way for more comprehensive and reliable cross-study comparisons.

## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
